lexUnit.name: thwart.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: prevent from succeeding in or accomplishing something.

sentence.text: Israel , strongly disagreeing with this interpretation , thwarted all American attempts at a diplomatic settlement .
Nina felt a dart of anger and pain that Tom should be thwarted in love .
One of the prime aims of the system of Soviets was being thwarted in this region , and in many others throughout Russia .
Burglars who broke into the Spennymoor Leisure Centre were thwarted in their efforts to break into the bar .
The farmer , thwarted in his desire to punish Uncle Fred , then vented his spite on Grandfather and the rest of the family .
Those responsible for implementing the change will be thwarted in their efforts if they can not have access to the resources they need .
FOUR would-be killers took over Ulster Tory Lawrence Kennedy 's home but were thwarted by his wife pressing a secret alarm button , Belfast Crown Court has heard .
He wants to , but his attempts are thwarted by an old enemy who could harm his wife 's business .
Hopes that harvesting which started over the weekend would continue , though , were thwarted by mid-week rain and a shortage of crops fully fit .
I intend to start alterations in spring and am determined not to be thwarted by cancer ( far less , the mere lack of money ) .
But in the early 1160s he had little success at bending the Welsh princes to his will , while one major invasion attempt in July 1165 was thwarted by atrocious summer weather .
` Do you think Kee knows how terribly she unintentionally thwarts me ? "
Looking back , I can see how infantile my behaviour was -- but then I was flushed with success , convinced that nothing and no one could thwart me . "
Your attempt to flee to Brazil was thwarted when the police caught your children smoking blanketweed .
Attempts to introduce the system in Japanese plants overseas have frequently been thwarted by the inability of component suppliers to meet quality and timing schedules .
The employer 's plans to export the invention may be thwarted by a volatile exchange rate or the unexpected imposition of heavy import tariffs in target markets .
But in the great tradition of the best-laid plans , I was thwarted by the arrival of Inspector Jackson and his merry men .
The threat has not only been partially thwarted by vehicle checkpoints but by close surveillance .
But their efforts to climb back out were continually thwarted by brittle rock , which made hand and foot holds difficult .
We were actively thwarted by English women who flung accusations at us .
But , more importantly at the time , he brought in Amstrad chief Sugar to help thwart a take-over bid by newspaper tycoon Robert Maxwell and save the club from possible bankruptcy .
On the contrary , her policies thwarted these energies .
Jack thwarts the mission to murder Lord Holmes ( James Fox ) .
Dana sulked because Roman had thwarted her plan to sit in the front passenger seat , and Claudia , conscious of her twin 's glowering presence , could n't find anything to say .
The intuition of two unarmed policemen thwarted the I R A's attempt to plant the biggest ever bomb in the capital .
Hitherto the government had been able to thwart all attempts by opposition leaders to form new parties , although the right to do so was formally enshrined in the Constitution .
The gulf between theory and practice , which can so easily thwart real progress at such meetings , was not in evidence here .
They have brought numerous legal challenges to thwart the original intentions of the MMPA .
Having been thwarted in his aims , was he going to swoop down at some unsuspected moment and engage her in another haranguing match ?
I believe that she may be the focal point through which the Ancient Adversary will try to thwart the designs of the Dark Ones . "
The travellers had already been thwarted by Gloucestershire police , who blocked entrances to a site in the Forest of Dean .
